59.heading: Mistik et Gigott--Miscellanea.
59.title: "Bozo, Robbie & Minou-Cat : Le Club des Trois"
59.author: Dominik Vallet
59.appears_in: text p. 69-80 in Cap'tain Swing, no. 114 (Sept. 2004).
notes: Describes three magazines. Bozo ran 18 issues from 1975 to 1977, and featured Bozo, Minitrick, Pon-pon, & Zim-Boum. Robbie was published in 12 numbers in 1976 and 1977, with features Robbie, Wippy & Trotty. Minou-Cat had 32 issues, 1975 to 1977, and features Minou-Cat, Miss Tigry, Mistik et Gigott, & Trompinet. The features are described, with dates and issue numbers, and minor features in Minou-Cat are listed. All three magazines were small format color publications for young children. A biographical sketch of Luciano Bottaro (1931-) is included.

66.heading: Mistral, Armando.
66.title: "Tritón"
66.author: by Daniel Torres
66.appears_in: p. 14-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 8, no. 9 (Dec. 1984).
notes: "Last issue, Armando Mistral agreed to go to Triton to remedy the world's drought. Just days before, his friend, scientist Pierre Covalsky, had been killed trying to do the same thing."

67.heading: Mistral, Armando.
67.title: "Tritón"
67.author: Daniel Torres
67.appears_in: p. 13-21 in Heavy Metal, v. 8, no. 10 (Jan. 1985).
notes: "Last we read Rocco Vargas (alias Armando Mistral) and Jill Covalsky were trying to find the iceberg fields, when their nemesis, Mung, got in their way. The secret icebergs must be found in order to end the world's drought."

68.heading: Mistral, Armando.
68.title: "The Whisper Mystery"
68.author: by Daniel Torres
68.appears_in: p. 44-51 in Heavy Metal, v. 9, no. 4 (July 1985).
notes: Synopsis (from p. 4): "While working on the new Sam Norton episode for SF magazine, Armando Mistral is visited by his old friend Chico Panama, a womanizer and a cheat. Unable to get rid of Panama, Mistral hotfoots it over to Montebahia for a bit of r&r, where he runs into Cuper and a bunch of thugs fighting it out."

69.heading: Mistral, Armando.
69.title: "The Whisper Mystery"
69.author: by Daniel Torres
69.appears_in: p. 41-48 in Heavy Metal, v. 9, no. 5 (Aug. 1985).
notes: "Catch Up (from p. 39): While working on the new Sam Norton episode for SF magazine, Armando Mistral is visited by his old friend Chico Panama, a womanizer and a cheat. Unable to get rid of Panama, Mistral hotfoots it over to Montebahia for a bit of r&r, where he runs into Archie Cooper, a Chandleresque detective, and a bunch of thugs fighting it out. Cooper is murderered by a bunch of human-size lizards, and Chop Jones (the man behind this whole drug-related mess in the first place) pays Mistral a visit."
